title: China ready to help Sri Lanka join BRICS
byline: China is among the countries which are ready to help Sri Lanka join the BRICS coalition in the future, a bloc with economies which account for an estimated 37.3% of global gross domestic product based on purchasing power parity, Daily Mirror learns.

title: India - Pakistan war not imminent
byline: A tense standoff prevails between India and Pakistan following the Pahalgam terrorist attack triggering concerns that it will explode into a full-blown war at any time with implications for the whole world.

title: Suspended IGP Tennakoon requests protection amid reported death threats
byline: Suspended Inspector General of Police (IGP) Deshabandu Tennakoon has reportedly requested security protection from the police, citing threats to his life.

title: IUSF calls for impartial probe into Sabaragamuwa Uni student’s death
byline: The Inter-University Students’ Federation (IUSF) called for an impartial investigation into the death of a student at Sabaragamuwa University, who reportedly committed suicide following an alleged incident of ragging.

title: Children fall ill in India ’after dead snake found in school meal’
byline: India’s human rights body is investigating reports that more than 100 children fell ill from eating a school lunch after a dead snake was found in the food.

title: Apple says most US-bound iPhones no longer made in China
byline: Apple says it is shifting production of most iPhones and other devices to be sold in the US away from China, which has been the focus of President Donald Trump’s tariffs.

title: March current account surplus hits US$ 693mn
byline: Sri Lanka’s external sector demonstrated strong performance in March 2025, with the highest monthly current account surplus since the compilation of these statistics began in January 2023, data released

title: Sri Lankan online shoppers stick to cash on delivery amid digital payment hesitation
byline: Despite global shifts toward digital transactions, Cash on Delivery (COD) remains the dominant payment method for online shopping in Sri Lanka, according to the Digital Outlook Sri Lanka 2025 Report by the

title: Construction sector shows modest growth in March as small-scale projects lead the way
byline: Sri Lanka’s construction sector showed signs of continued expansion in March, with the Purchasing Managers’ Index (PMI) for Construction reaching 54.3.

title: No order cancellations yet despite US tariffs: Brandix
byline: Brandix, Sri Lanka’s largest apparel exporter confirmed that US tariffs imposed on imports have not yet triggered order cancellations through September.

title: Legal action against buses parked at Welipenna Expressway
byline: Legal action will be taken against buses parked along the Southern Expressway service area at Welipenna, the Express Highway Patrol Division announced.

title: SLPP  Candidate remanded for bribery
byline: The Revenue Officer of the Akmeemana Pradeshiya Sabha, one of the SLPP candidates contesting the elections for the Imaduwa Pradeshiya Sabha,  was taken into custody on suspicion of accepting a bribe of Rs. 25,000 to issue a trade licence for a hotel in the Unawatuna area.

title: Vesak Poya Day should not be turned into day of musical shows or carnivals: Public Administration Ministry
byline: The Vesak Poya Day (12) should not be turned into a day of musical shows or carnivals but the day should be spent as a full religious day to make practice-based offerings (Pratipatti Pooja) in commemoration of the Sambudu Themagula (the threefold sacred events of Lord Buddha’s life), the Ministry of Public Administration, Provincial Councils and Local Government said in a circular.

title: 24-hour passport issuing service suspended for three days due to LG polls
byline: The 24-hour service to issue passports under the one-day service has been suspended on May 5, 6 and 7 due to the Local Government elections, the Immigration and Emigration Department said.

title: PM Modi inaugurates Adani-owned Vizhinjam Port in Kerala
byline: Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated the Vizhinjam port in Kerala on Friday, India’s first deepwater transshipment port. The inauguration is seen as an important step in improving India’s shipping strength and cutting down the cost of moving goods by sea.

title: President to deliver keynote address at Vietnam’s Vesak ceremony
byline: President Anura Kumara  Dissanayake will participate in the United Nations Day of Vesak ceremony being held in Ho Chi Minh City in Vietnam as the chief guest during his visit to Vietnam, the Foreign Ministry said.

title: Hundreds of cars get flat tyres after truck spills scrap metal
byline: Hundreds of cars were left with flat tyres after a truck travelling along one of Australia’s busiest highways spilled 750kg (1,653lb) of sharp metal shards on the road.

title: Suspect dies in police custody in Kosgoda
byline: A young man who was arrested with drugs yesterday, died while in the custody of the Kosgoda police this afternoon.

title: Chile issues tsunami warning after earthquake
byline: Chile has issued a tsunami warning and said people should evacuate a coastal area in the south of country after a large earthquake.

title: Seized LTTE valuables handed over to Govt. by Army
byline: A stock of items previously seized by the Sri Lanka Army from the LTTE for investigative purposes was officially handed over to the government at the Sri Lanka Army Headquarters today (2), following the conclusion of relevant investigations.

title: Ireland fines TikTok 530 million euros for sending EU user data to China
byline: TikTok has been fined 530 million euros ($601.3 million) by Ireland’s privacy regulator for sending user data to China.

title: Ten dead, dozens injured in Philippines bus crash
byline: Ten people have been killed and more than 30 injured after a bus hit several vehicles at a toll gate on one of the busiest highways in northern Philippines, authorities say.

title: Harshitha, Kavisha lift Sri Lanka to first win
byline: Half tons by Harshitha Samarawickrama and Kavisha Dilhari helped Sri Lanka to record a five-wicket win over South Africa in the Sri Lanka Women’s Tri-Nation ODI series tournament played at R. Premadasa Stadium.

title: No secret who instigated SL protests against Kashmir attack: Pakistan HC
byline: Responding to a protest held outside its office in Colombo by a group of local persons against the Kashmiri terror attack, the Pakistan High Commission said it is no secret who has instigated these protests in Sri Lanka.

title: CSE begins May with positive momentum
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) started the May with a positive trading session from the beginning to end, supported by a strong rebound in investor sentiment.

title: Trans women banned from English women’s cricket
byline: Transgender women have been banned from playing in women’s and girls’ cricket in England and Wales after the governing body announced a change in policy on Friday.

title: Businessman remanded over major vehicle registration frauds
byline: A businessman who owns a vehicle sales showroom in Wariyapola was ordered to be remnded till 9 May by Colombo Chief Magistrate Thanuja Lakmali for allegedly causing a loss of over Rs. 50 million in unpaid taxes to the government.

title: Countrywide liquor sales restricted on LG polls day
byline: Sale of all alcoholic beverages through liquor outlets countrywide will be banned on Tuesday, May 6 in view of the Local Government elections day by order of the Excise Chief and this ruling is exempted for the in-house guests of all Tourist Board approved hotels and boutique villas.
